content: GF#12773 proposes that datatypes should be accessible direclty from the navbar. Well, I don't agree. There's a link from the front page, and it's just otherwise not significant enough. But interested in discussion....
I use this link all the times - but my use case is as a profiler and standards developer so that may put me in the minority.

I use that link all the time as well, but no more often than I use the Search and REST API links. I tend to agree, they're on the home page, not that big a deal that they're not on the nav bar, to me anyway.
I could see a "reference" menu being useful with Resources, Data Types, Search, REST, that sort of stuff.
But the navbar itself is precious real estate.
The data-type link is on the Welcome page under foundation. I don't see any need to add to navy bar.
Maybe add a link at the bottom of Resource page?
I don't have a need for it. Usually when I need it, i'm looking at a resource and click through the property direct to the correct bookmark.

I'm at the point where I tend to just type the URL for the data types (and sometimes the anchor for the type I want to jump to). I don't see the data types as being more relevant than many of the other key pages - and they're well linked from the resources which is the context most implementers will need to reach them from.
